newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Index little changed in Nigerian share trading.
newsitem.headline: Index little changed in Nigerian share trading.

text.p: Trading on the Nigerian stock market was bullish on Thursday on increased investors' activities but the share index ended little changed, dealers said.
The all-share index closed at 7483.35, slightly down from 7483.36 on Wednesday.
"Investors are now rushing to buy bank shares while food, beverages and oil equities continued to advance on good prospects," on dealer said.

Shares of Union Bank ended at 10.75 naira, up 50 kobo. First Bank chalked up 30 kobo at 12.30 naira because investors were buying in anticipation of bonus issues in their bid to raise their capital base.
Oil shares surged to new heights on what some worried brokers called subjective price-making. "The way they are making the prices, there may be a crash," said one.
Total Plc gained 1.50 naira to close at 68.30 naira in anticipation of a good result while Unipetrol finshed at 71.20 naira, up by 70 kobo.
Agip rose by 50 kobo to 27.60 naira, National Oil was 56.00 naira, 45 kobo higher and African Petroleum closed 40 kobo more at 54.44 naira.
Cadbury's impressive full-year result posted last week continued to make waves as demand for its shares increased. It ended 30.40 naira, up by 1.40 naira.
Dunlop maintained its steady rise, up by 20 kobo to 10.00 naira while Okomu Oilpalm finished 15 kobo higher at 11.60 naira.
Healthcare firm Smithkline Beecham was the day's notable loser. It shed 20 kobo to 7.50 naira.
